name: Ladera Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped hear for drinks and canopies as part of a boat tour to the Pitons. Wow, what a resort...the #1 resort in the world in 2005. Oprah stays there, so it must be top shelf. The view from the bar is incredible with a view between both peaks. Although we did not stay there, the rooms have only 3 walls, open to the water views. Great honeymoon destination, but a bit pricy.
reviews.title: Wow, what a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time to Saint Lucia and it was for our honeymoon. The entire island is amazing, but the Ladera resort really captures the best qualities of the country. Let me preface this review first by saying that the first 6 nights in Saint Lucia we stayed at a different, "chain" resort on the other side of the island. This resort was twice as expensive, and they called it "all inclusive". This other resort was extremely Americanized and it felt like I was still in the US.
reviews.title: This resort hits EVERY point!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That was not the case at Ladera. When you are greeted and personally escorted to your room, it’s like you're walking into a dream. We kept pinching ourselves and saying, "oh my gosh. This cannot be real!" The woman who escorted us to our room took the time to point out everything in the room, which came in handy! She told us that on Sundays (the day we arrived), they have a buffet with many authentic Saint Lucian foods. On our way to dinner, we were greeted by a sweet lady named Holly. She walked with us to the restaurant and gave us suggestions on what dishes to try. Being that we had been eating hamburgers, Japanese Hibachi, and pizza for the past 6 days, we were VERY interested. My favorite was the curried goat - but everything on my plate was delicious! I will say, it was a bit pricey, but we felt it was worth it! When we arrived back to our room, we found a chilled bottle of champagne and a hand written note from Holly ... the OWNER, which she failed to mention when we first met her. Wow... what a personal touch. Not a few words of greetings, it was a full handwritten note to me and my new husband wishing us a wonderful stay and a happy life together. It really touched our hearts. A continental breakfast is included. You can upgrade your breakfast by adding a couple dollars – which is totally worth it. And again, the food is authentic Saint Lucian dishes. Every meal we had at the resort was delicious. Internet is also available at no charge – that was very nice! We were able to facetime our family and friends and show off the beautiful room and view. They were SO jealous! The resort provides complimentary snorkeling gear. They have a shuttle that runs down to the beach 3 times a day. The snorkeling in this cove is better than the 2 scuba dives that we did at the other resort. There were so many different kinds of sea creatures. We saw squids, an octopus, as wells as thousands of fish!
reviews.title: Unforgettable Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was just incredible. The view took my breath away every time I looked out upon the Pitons and the bay with crystal blue water and white sandy beaches. The bed is draped with a beautiful white net… which is more functional than just a decoration. The bed and pillows are very comfy! The shower is a piece of art – just beautiful! There’s a pool in every room. The pool is amazing with a little trickling waterfall to drown out any noises and give some privacy. The pool was very cold though. I think we only got in once… which was disappointing. There’s a sun deck out over the forest. Just simply put: incredible. It seems the owner/staff have thought of everything. There was a fruit plate waiting for us when we arrived. There was insect repellant in the room, along with mosquito bite itch relief spray. And the best amenity that was included in the room was the ear plugs! With the room being open to the elements we experienced some loud animal noises (birds and tree frogs) throughout the night.
reviews.title: Incredible honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My tip – when going to Saint Lucia, don’t stay at the chain resorts…
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings! What an experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I took a trip to St. Lucia in June and we are STILL shocked we ever came back. If we could have stayed forever, we would have.
reviews.title: Beyond Extraordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even during rainy season, this hotel was an absolute treasure. By far the best hotel experience I have ever had. Our room was massive, the food was amazing, and the view-breathtaking at every turn.
reviews.title: Simply amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband I stayed here for our anniversary. We were stunned at the gorgeous scenery and beautifully decorated room! Most of the woodwork in the hotel is carved locally and was almost as amazing as the views. The staff are friendly and aim to please above and beyond your expectations. We loved every minute and hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort has amazing views and great food. The only downside was that the hot tub was not working for part of the time we were there. The restaurant is excellent as well and we did not have a bad meal there.
reviews.title: Amazing honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Ladera for the last 4 days of our honeymoon and it was amazing. The views alone are worth the stay. The food is great, rooms are beautiful, and everyone is friendly and accommodating. Holly, one of the owners, was very gracious and genuinely cared about the people who were there. I would recommend this for anyone who is looking for a unique vacation spot. Thanks again Holly!
reviews.title: A review of words is simply not good enough...
Beautiful property, very nice staff
reviews.text: Generally, I don't do reviews for places that have hundreds of reviews already.  Little new can be said that hasn't been said before.  But, for this hotel, I thought I'd add mine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read 20 or so recent reviews, I couldn't help notice  a certain similarity.  It seems vast majority of them have been written by newly married ladies who are still getting used to the idea of being married, thus the preponderance of "my husband" this and " my husband" that.
reviews.title: Amazing view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With the glow of the wedding still upon them, they gush over incredible views and attentive service.  So, if you are a bride to be,  planning a honeymoon, pay close attention to their trip reports.
reviews.title: Wow!
Breathtaking
reviews.text: This one, though, is for the fellows.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're a couple visiting St Lucia, Ladera IS THE place to stay!!! We just spent 3 incredible days at Ladera and cannot stop raving about it! The open air suite was absolutely stunning, the view mind blowing. At night we'd sit in the open air lounge, in the plunge pool (overlooking the valley, Sugar Beach and the Pitons) or on the bed, listening to the incredible sounds of nature. We just witnessed the best sunsets and the most incredible mornings!
reviews.title: Ladera... A little slice of heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't expect TV's... this is a resort to get away from it all... to enjoy your other half! There is free wifi though. Holly the owner is so lovely and down to Earth! And the staff gorgeous! A special mention of Cassandra, one of the duty managers.
reviews.title: Something different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside to it is that Ladera is just outside Soufriere so there is no choice of restaurants. (Not that we would've ventured to try the food at Soufriere!!!) The restaurant at Ladera, Dasheene, has great food, although overpriced. And renting a car was the best thing we did!! Gave us so much liberty to do what we wanted to do... and saved on a lot of money!!!
reviews.title: Great Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ladera is a little slice of heaven! We didn't care much about St Lucia as a holidaying destination - but Ladera was something else!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Anniversary Destination!

reviews.text: We recently returned from our stay at Ladera. it was wonderful. The staff and the locals are extremely friendly and very willing to make your stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Beautiful view, outstanding food, great service

description: Ladera opened in November 1992 and has since been distinguished by a wide range of international publications, awards and accolades from Conde Nast Traveler, Travel + Leisure, Forbes Life Caribbean Travel and Life, Brides Magazine and countless others. Ladera was once part of Rabot Estate, one of Soufriere’s oldest plantations, which still borders the resort. In the late 1960’s a parcel of land was sold and developed into a small cluster of condominiums and christened Dasheene, named after the thousands of large, glossy-leafed dasheen plants (also known as elephant ears) harvested on the site. In 1982 it was transformed into a unique resort and changed hands a number of times before emerging as Ladera under the current private ownership. The mission has always been to offer an unparalleled guest experience that is quintessentially Saint Lucian, one that embraces the magnificent views and offers harmony with the surrounding natural beauty and rich bounty of the island. Today, that commitment to sumptuous authenticity is evident in everything from the innovative renderings of fresh local dishes at Dasheene restaurant, to the use of Caribbean timbers, stone and tile work used in the guestrooms and public areas. Yet it shines through most effectively with warm and welcoming Saint Lucian staff.
